v.v: Now those who are younger than I have nothing but mockery for me—
Indeed, the strength of their fathers’ hands, how could it have helped me—
They were thin from poverty and hunger;
They plucked saltwort and bushes’ leaves;
They were driven out from among people
So they had to live in river valleys,
Among the bushes they brayed like donkeys
They were the sons of fools, indeed, sons of nameless people!

v: these young men whose fathers I would have refused to allow to work beside the dogs of my flock.
men in whom the strength of their mature age had perished?
they gnawed at the dry ground in the darkness of wilderness and desolation.
the roots of the broom tree were their food.
who shouted after them as one would shout after a thief.
in holes of the earth and of the rocks.
and they gathered together under the nettles.
They were driven out of the land with whips.

v.v: But now I have become the subject of their taunting song;
They abhor me and stand far off from me;
For God has unstrung the string to my bow and afflicted me,
Upon my right hand rise the rabble;
They destroy my path;
They come against me like an army through a wide hole in a city wall;
Terrors are turned upon me;

v: I have become a byword for them.
they do not refrain from spitting in my face.
and those who taunt me cast off restraint before my face.
they drive me away and
pile up against me their siege mounds.
they push forward disaster for me,
men who have no one to hold them back.
in the midst of the destruction they roll themselves in on me.
my honor is driven away as if by the wind;
my prosperity passes away as a cloud.

v.v: Now my life is pouring out from within me;
In the night my bones in me are pierced;
God’s great force has seized my clothing;
He has thrown me into the mud;
I cry to you, God, but you do not answer me;
You have changed and become cruel to me;
You lift me up to the wind and cause it to drive me along;
For I know that you will bring me to death,

v: many days of suffering have laid hold on me.
the pains that gnaw at me take no rest.
it wraps around me like the collar of my tunic.
I have become like dust and ashes.
I stand up, and you merely look at me.
with the strength of your hand you persecute me.
you throw me back and forth in a storm.
to the house appointed for all the living.

v.v: However, does no one reach out with his hand to beg for help when he falls?
Did not I weep for him who was in trouble?
When I hoped for good, then evil came;
My heart is troubled and does not rest;
I have gone about like one who was living in the dark,
I am a brother to jackals,
My skin is black and falls away from me;
Therefore my harp is tuned for songs of mourning,

v: Does no one in trouble call out for help?
Did I not grieve for the needy man?
when I waited for light, darkness came instead.
days of affliction have come on me.
but not because of the sun;
I stand up in the assembly and cry for help.
a companion of ostriches.
my bones are burned with heat.
my flute for the singing of those who wail.
